intro: Euploca ottonii, commonly known as the Otto's euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It features slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in coastal areas. Euploca ottonii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
